textParagraph.text: test@tester.com asked:  what is a debt relief order?

Based on the documents provided, here are the key details about what a debt relief order (DRO) is:- A DRO is an agreement you make with a DRO adviser, also known as an 'approved intermediary', if you cannot pay your debts. - The DRO adviser will help determine if you are eligible to apply for a DRO. They will look at your income, outgoings, debts and assets. - To apply for a DRO, you need to pay a ¬£90 fee. The application is sent to an official receiver at the Insolvency Service who will make a decision.- If approved, the DRO lasts usually for 1 year. During this time, your debts are frozen. After the DRO period ends, the debts are cancelled. - You need to be honest in your DRO application. If you get a refund over ¬£1000 for mis-sold PPI while under a DRO, your DRO could be cancelled.- Citizens Advice is authorized to help clients apply for DROs on their behalf.In summary, a DRO is an agreement made through an adviser to freeze and eventually cancel debts if you cannot afford to pay
How to get a debt relief order - Home
Check if you can complain about mis-sold PPI - Citizens Advice
Using our Debt Relief Order (DRO) service - our privacy policy - Citizens Advice
